page.title: 07Tourism in Morwenstow
page.content:
A rural area and ideal for energetic hikers naturalists and those who enjoy to ramble in rugged countryside. There are no campsites but some farms and houses welcome visitors and offer good accommodation. The National Trust has holiday chalets at Coombe Mill in a pretty wooded valley with nature trail footpaths maintained by the Cornwall Naturalist Trust. The coombe ends at Duckpool beach bounded by high cliffs.
North Cornwall Cars provide a shopping bus two days a week to Holsworthy and Bude,but personal transport is a must. Respect for the land and a reluctance to change has helped to keep this area so natural. A notable recent exception being the signals station whose dish aerials dominate the skyline and are of added interest to the scientific minded tourist.
